greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(5).
comment: Also known as the 5th Bendersky constant.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.15 Glaisher-Kinkelin constant, p. 137.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2004
formula: A(k) = exp(B(k+1)/(k+1)*H(k)-zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number and H(k) the k-th harmonic number.
Equals exp(gamma/252 - 15*Zeta'(6)/(4*Pi^6)) * (2*Pi)^(1/252), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 25 2015
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 02 2014
